Job Title: Project Management Associate

Location: Illinois, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Job description:

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:[ Position Summary ]Drive innovation and change to manage and lead project so that team members may feel inspired, empowered, and connected to the company’s mission of creating “Movement that inspires”Work directly with PM to help implement project goals (Assist to determine and define project scope and objectives)Oversee variable aspects of projects and provide direct assistance to ensure timely project executionOverview project goals and ensure project goals are achievable (Liaise with project lead and other related managers to maintain project schedule and efficacy)Track project costs in order to meet budgetProvide project updates on a consistent basis to various stakeholders about strategy, adjustments, and progress (If necessary, assist coordinate with project managers and other project leads following project execution)Assist developing and managing a detailed project schedule and work plan (Review project implementation and gather data on project execution)Measure project performance to identify and suggest areas for improvement  [ Major Job Responsibilities ]Establishment of plant event schedule and progress management for new EV model projects – consultation on schedule adjustment among relevant departments, etc.Establishment of supplementary investment plans and management of progress Check the progress of other project-related tasks, identify problems, report to PM and implement instructions/ordersCheck performance and management index achievement status of each shopOperating a working-level inspection meeting and preparing regular reports on the achievement of management indexComprehensive business plan and check progress status of each shop (voluntary management in the planning and implementation stage)Role as a communication channel between the production plant and the head office (working-level consultation focused on local personnel)Preparation of reports for management visits and local executives. Comprehensive management supports such as local self-implemented construction, supplementary investment, etc.Comply with company policies and procedures, actively participate in employee trainingActively participate in collaborative activities with related departments and strengthening organizational capabilities for communication and collaboration between Americans and Koreans  [ Qualifications & Preferences ]Strong familiarity with project management methodologies, best practices and MS OfficeExcellent analytical skillsStrong interpersonal skills and extremely resourcefulProven ability to complete projects according to outlined scope, budget, and timeline. Highly organized and detail-oriented with a passion for ensuring projects proceed efficiently and effectivelyProject Management Professional (PMP) certification preferredA Bachelor's degree or above in a field related to the project management, Industrial Engineering, Business Administration may be preferred [ Others ]Flexibility in working hours to include weekends, holidays, and off shift. Position may require on-call duty or overtime due to overall responsibility.Normal office duties and overnight travel required approximately 5-10%  Competency Based: Working as a TeamPlanning and OrganizingChallenge and Problem SolvingCommunication and CollaborationStrategic thinking and mindsetWillingness for transformational changesGlobality & Flexibility  Travel RequirementDomestic / International travel required  Expected Start DateNegotiable  Recruitment Process & ScheduleTBD  Compensation & BenefitHMGMA offers opportunities for growth, work flexibility and competitive pay and benefits.HMGMA offers our employees with competitive Medical / Vision / Dental insurance.HMGMA offers relocation package as HR PolicyThe 401K will be applied to employees from 2023  Other InformationLocation : 131 Hutchinson Island Rd, Savannah, GA 31421 Contact Information : MR_Skwang.OH@hyundai.com

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
